title: Recycling rolls forward for 15K Bay City households - Michigan Courts
published_parsed: time.struct_time(tm_year=2023, tm_mon=3, tm_mday=29, tm_hour=7, tm_min=0, tm_sec=0, tm_wday=2, tm_yday=88, tm_isdst=0)
summary: Recycling rolls forward for 15K Bay City households  Michigan Courts
title_detail.value: Recycling rolls forward for 15K Bay City households - Michigan Courts
summary_detail.value: Recycling rolls forward for 15K Bay City households  Michigan Courts
source.title: Michigan Courts
text: Curbside recycling is on a roll in Bay City, as the city replaced 18-gallon totes with 96-gallon rolling carts – at five times the capacity – for 15,000 households. The switch took place late last year. Recycling carts rolled into Bay City with help from an EGLE infrastructure grant and The Recycling Partnership. Grants from the Michigan Department of Environment, Great Lakes, and Energy (EGLE), trade association American Beverage’s Every Bottle Back initiative, and the nonprofit Recycling Partnership covered the cost of the carts plus education and outreach about the city’s new every-other-week recycling collection schedule that started Jan. 2. The city is the first Great Lakes Bay Region community partnering with the state to provide the carts. At a kickoff event, Bay City Parks and Environmental Affairs Manager Tim Botzau said the change is expected to more than double Bay City’s pickup of recyclable materials, from 160 pounds a year per household to an estimated 350 pounds a year. The estimated 1,425 additional tons collected will bring the community total closer to 2,626 tons a year, an all-time high. EGLE Recycling Specialist Tracy Purrenhage said curbside carts are a high-priority way to increase collection of materials that can be reused and repurposed into new products and to keep recyclable materials from going into landfills. Michigan’s MI Healthy Climate Plan for economywide carbon neutrality by 2050 includes a goal of tripling Michigan’s recycling rate to 45% from 2005-2030. “Our goal is to make it easier than ever before for Bay City residents – and others who live in the Great Lakes Bay Region and across Michigan – to reduce, reuse and recycle items instead of throwing them away in the garbage,” Purrenhage said. The new curbside pickup service will use trucks equipped with mechanical arms to pick up and empty carts. Bay City residents can find collection scheduled information and answers to frequently asked questions at BayCityRecycles.org. Officials ask that residents continue to do their part by placing only recyclable materials in the recycling carts, including glass bottles and jars, aluminum and steel cans, food and beverage cartons, paper products (including newspapers and flattened cardboard), and empty plastic bottles and containers. Food and drink containers should be rinsed. Items that cannot be recycled include plastic bags, paper towels, electrical equipment, batteries, and clothing. Find more recycling do’s and don’ts on EGLE’s recycling information website, RecyclingRaccoons.org.

title: Shopping sustainable? Check out these products from Four Hands - Home Accents Today
published_parsed: time.struct_time(tm_year=2023, tm_mon=3, tm_mday=15, tm_hour=7, tm_min=0, tm_sec=0, tm_wday=2, tm_yday=74, tm_isdst=0)

title_detail.value: Shopping sustainable? Check out these products from Four Hands - Home Accents Today
summary_detail.value: Shopping sustainable? Check out these products from Four Hands  Home Accents Today
source.title: Home Accents Today
text: Four Hands supports eco-conscious sourcing and design, while crafting pieces with mindfully made materials. The company offers hundreds of products that have a sustainable aspect. Take a look. FSC-Certified woods FSC-Certified woods are considered the “gold standard” in ethical production as they are harvested from responsibly-managed forests. Four Hands uses these woods in many outdoor collections. Fiqa Four Hands upholsters many products with Fiqa, an antimicrobial, stain-resistant and machine-washable performance fabric made from fully recyclable materials. The durable fabric can be recycled repeatedly. Libeco Four Hands partnered with Libeco to source authentic Belgian linen, a naturally durable fabric grown and harvested using a traditional approach. Libeco Belgian linen products are produced in a carbon-neutral facility without the use of toxic chemicals. Upcycled and recycled Four Hands finds new ways to upcycle, recycle and source sustainably from repurposing water bottles into luxurious fabrics to salvaging raw hides for a sustainable twist on leathers.

title: What’s Next for Cleaning Brands? - Licensing International
published_parsed: time.struct_time(tm_year=2023, tm_mon=3, tm_mday=7, tm_hour=8, tm_min=0, tm_sec=0, tm_wday=1, tm_yday=66, tm_isdst=0)
summary: What’s Next for Cleaning Brands?  Licensing International
title_detail.value: What’s Next for Cleaning Brands? - Licensing International
summary_detail.value: What’s Next for Cleaning Brands?  Licensing International
source.title: Licensing International
text: What’s Next for Cleaning Brands? Sales of household cleaning products surged during the pandemic, but what does demand for these brands look like in a post-Covid world? While annual sales growth has slowed to 3-4% (from a peak of 15% during the pandemic), companies in this space are appealing to customers by putting the “clean” back in cleaning, according to executives at the Inspired Home Show in Chicago this week. In a market where licensed mops, sponges, cleaning gloves, and other products account for a large share of the business, many companies are promoting natural and green cleaners stripped of harmful chemicals and featuring recyclable packaging. And in a category where price has traditionally been king, consumers are showing a willingness to pay more for natural and organic products that benefit the environment. Overall, global sales of household cleaning products are expected to increase 4.4% annually to $334.1 billion in 2029. “We really have to make sure we are on the cutting edge [of ingredients and product design] because consumers’ perception of what disinfectant and antimicrobial means has changed,” said Danielle Caltabiano, VP of Omnichannel Sales and Marketing at Ginsey Home Solutions. Ginsey sells products under the licensed Clorox (antimicrobial plastic toilet seats, bath mats) and Arm & Hammer (odor eliminator) brands and is readying Clorox-branded kitchen cleaning products for launch in early 2024, Caltabiano said. And Bradshaw is using more recyclable materials in packaging as well as readying a new design of the Mr. Clean character for later this year. The redesign will replace the image of Mr. Clean with his arms folded across his chest with, in the case of gloves, one hand reaching out from the packaging. And while clean ingredients and sustainable packaging are important to many consumers, factors like availability and price can outweigh those concerns for other customers. “Cleaning product preferences differ from person to person and can be influenced by psychographic, demographic, and behavioral factors, which are impacted by lifestyle standards and awareness,” according to a Fortune Business Insights report. “Consumer loyalty and product distinctiveness are difficult to maintain in today’s market for household cleaning products. Consumers are frequently driven to innovative items so are unable to remain loyal to a single product or brand. Small and medium-size manufacturers are challenged to keep up with trends due to changing consumer preferences. As a result, these issues together limit market expansion.” Other efforts to expand the cleaning supplies market, such as outbound licensing, are also an area of focus moving forward. This is especially true for rapidly growing cleaning brands like Scrub Daddy. The company is launching new products (mops and all-purpose cleaning creams) under its own brand to extend beyond its top-selling scrubbing sponges, said Jennifer Orr Picariello, VP of Sales and Marketing at Scrub Daddy. Additionally, Scrub earlier this year signed an agreement to develop co-branded product with Unilever’s Cif household cleaning products. “It is all about mindshare and, if it’s about commodity, people are going to buy the cheapest thing. But if you win mindshare and inspire consumers, they will love your brand,” said Joseph Derochowski, VP and Advisor for Home and Home Improvement industries at The NPD Group.

title: LoeschPack set for major packaging showcase at Interpack 2023 - Confectionery Production
published_parsed: time.struct_time(tm_year=2023, tm_mon=3, tm_mday=11, tm_hour=8, tm_min=0, tm_sec=0, tm_wday=5, tm_yday=70, tm_isdst=0)
summary: LoeschPack set for major packaging showcase at Interpack 2023  Confectionery Production
title_detail.value: LoeschPack set for major packaging showcase at Interpack 2023 - Confectionery Production
summary_detail.value: LoeschPack set for major packaging showcase at Interpack 2023  Confectionery Production
source.title: Confectionery Production
text: A raft of new innovations has been promised from German-based LoeschPack packaging specialist for this year’s key Interpack event in Dusseldorf this May, reports Neill Barston. Notably, the business explained to Confectionery Production that it will be placing a strong emphasis on delivering complete systems that have a high degree of focus on sustainable operation. The company will be at Hall 14, Booth C22 for the major global event taking place between May 4-10, alongside sister company Hastamat, the Franconian packaging machine manufacturer showcasing its own extensive portfolio. With its bar line and its combined line, LoeschPack is presenting several integrated packaging solutions to the trade audience at once: from primary packaging to the sales tray. The spotlight will be on new pack styles that use sustainable and recyclable materials. “We want to help our customers pack their products faster, more sustainably, and more efficiently,” says Olaf Piepenbrock, Managing Partner of LoeschPack, Hastamat, and parent company Piepenbrock. “We achieve this with our new, high-performance packaging lines, their ease of handling, and our packaging process, which is perfectly tailored to the product. This is our way of continuing to live up to our corporate promise of ‘Packaging your ideas…’ to a global audience.” The packaging machine manufacturer has completely rethought the principle of horizontal flow wrap packaging – and developed a modular packaging line: from the buffer via the feeder, the bar packed in the flow pack arrives ready for the sales tray. And all the production steps are carried out from a single source. For this completely new development, LoeschPack focused on a hygienic design, simple operation, and a small footprint. All machines are equipped with the new “easyMI” HMI (Human- Machine Interface) with an 18.5-inch touchscreen. As the company noted, clear, simple visualisations and shortcuts ensure that users are fully supported at all times. Machine operators and maintenance personnel can now operate the machines more easily and access a wide range of control and performance components. They are also assisted by a new mobile service app that makes it much easier to contact our service specialists through a secure connection should the need ever arise. It’s an attractive overall package – and equipped with everything needed for flexible and efficient production. Whether for a multilevel or gondola buffer system, the LOOP buffer system is specially designed to meet the requirements of large-scale production for bars and other confectionery products. With integrated storage systems, LoeschPack is succeeding in increasing efficiency and regulating production flow. The system is directly linked to the latest- generation LOMATIC, a feeding and distribution system designed for all speed ranges. In addition to chocolate, the machine also processes cookies, wafers, and granola bars. Row by row, the LOMATIC feeds the downstream packaging machines – at a speed of up to 160 rows per minute. From Napolitains to 300-gram bars. The design is optimised for running accuracy, a long service life, easy cleaning, and simple and fast size changeovers. Flow wrapping developments The fully revised CMT packs the incoming bars from the FHW-S horizontal flow wrapping machine in cardboard. The highly flexible top loading cartoning system from the LoeschPack C-series is space-saving and suitable for secondary packaging of a wide variety of pre-packed products for the confectionery, food, and non-food sectors. The particularly powerful application straightens up the flat carton blanks and both fills and seals them. Considering the speed performance, the required space and footprint of the toploader are very small. The CMT can handle an infeed of up to 1,000 products per minute at its maximum speed – with a maximum output of up to 200 cartons. The incoming products from the flow wrapping machine are turned 90 degrees with a simple turning device, decelerated, and fed to the racetrack. And it is not just size changeovers that are easy: the machine is also easily accessible to operators for cleaning and maintenance work. The cable routing within the base frame ensures an uncluttered design. No matter whether the customer needs a high-speed inline variant, a traditional 90- degree infeed, or dual-lane infeed, the CMT is available in versions that reflect these requirements. This rounds off LoeschPack’s product range in the field of cartoning. LTM-Duo With the LTM-DUO combined line, LoeschPack is presenting the trade audience its integrated, flexible, and fully comprehensive system solution for packaging chocolate bars. The successful LTM-DUO model combines perfect packaging and machines with a high degree of automation, low personnel requirements, and a small footprint. The flexible LTM-DUO fold wrapping machine packs more than 200 chocolate bars per minute in a tightly sealed primary wrap. The outer wrap of the chocolate bar can be a paper label from a stack or reel, or it can be a cardboard label. The machine is joined by the CMW cartoning module. The machine fills 30 display cartons per minute – for perfect product presentation on the supermarket shelf. An integrated buffer between the primary packaging and cartoning stages prevents product rejects in the event of downtime. Only one hot glue device and a controller with the new HMI are required for the entire line. This has a positive effect on procurement costs and parts procurement. In addition, the complete system can be operated by a single person who can keep an eye on operating conditions at all times. The system’s compact design takes up significantly less space than comparable layouts. This makes the combined line significantly more cost-effective than a configuration with two stand-alone machines. The CMW cartoning module can be flexibly combined – and is also available as a stand-alone version. This means, for example, that it can be operated in a layout with two upstream fold wrapping or flow wrapping machines. In the future, an upgrade kit will also be available, allowing an older LTM-DUO to be easily combined with the new system. Related content

title: Top 10 Best Non-Leather Footwear Companies In USA 2023 - Inventiva
published_parsed: time.struct_time(tm_year=2023, tm_mon=3, tm_mday=27, tm_hour=7, tm_min=0, tm_sec=0, tm_wday=0, tm_yday=86, tm_isdst=0)
summary: Top 10 Best Non-Leather Footwear Companies In USA 2023  Inventiva
title_detail.value: Top 10 Best Non-Leather Footwear Companies In USA 2023 - Inventiva
summary_detail.value: Top 10 Best Non-Leather Footwear Companies In USA 2023  Inventiva
source.title: Inventiva
text: INTRODUCTION In the United States, one of the leading non-leather footwear companies in 2023 is Earth Shoes. Founded in 1972, Earth Shoes specializes in creating eco-friendly and sustainable shoes made from recycled and recyclable materials such as cotton, hemp, and natural rubber. They are committed to using sustainable practices, such as using biodegradable packaging and avoiding single-use plastics. Additionally, Earth Shoes has innovative designs that incorporate ergonomic features to ensure maximum comfort and support. Moreover, they also have a wide selection of stylish options that are perfect for any occasion. Another popular non-leather footwear company in the US is Allbirds. Founded in 2016, Allbirds offers a variety of high-quality and comfortable shoes made from eco-friendly materials such as Merino wool and eucalyptus tree fiber. Allbirds have a unique design which incorporates an ultra-cushioned midsole, breathable upper material, and anti-microbial treatment to help keep feet dry and odor-free. They also have a range of styles to choose from, such as sneakers, boots, slippers, and more. Lastly, Native Shoes is another great option for those looking for non-leather footwear. Native Shoes is focused on creating lightweight and breathable shoes with a minimalist design. Their shoes are made from a variety of materials including recycled PET plastic, chrome-free leather, and cork. Native Shoes also has a range of fashion-forward shoes that come in various colors and styles. IMPORTANCE The importance of non-leather footwear companies in the USA in 2023 is immense. The growing demand for eco-friendly and sustainable materials, as well as rising consumer awareness regarding the cruelty involved in leather production, has caused a surge in the popularity of non-leather footwear. Companies specializing in producing vegan or animal-free clothing lines are seeing a sharp rise in their sales. Furthermore, due to the increasing cost of animal-based leather, many consumers are looking for alternative options that are both stylish and affordable. In the US, non-leather footwear companies are providing a great opportunity for retail stores to attract customers who are seeking an ethically conscious shoe. There are a variety of styles and designs available, ranging from trainers to formal shoes, each made with high-quality, eco-friendly materials. These companies are also offering products at competitive prices, making them highly attractive to potential buyers. Additionally, these companies are working to ensure that the manufacturing process is done responsibly, using sustainable alternatives instead of chemical solvents and other pollutants. This helps to reduce the environmental impact of the industry while still producing durable and fashionable shoes. As more people become aware of their purchasing power and its potential to help protect the environment, the demand for these kinds of products will continue to increase in the coming years. Non-leather footwear companies could also benefit from partnering up with retailers and fashion houses to promote their items. This would give these companies greater visibility and allow them to reach a wider audience. Additionally, it would provide an opportunity for them to showcase the latest innovations and designs, allowing them to stay ahead of the curve. Overall, the importance of non-leather footwear companies in the USA in 2023 is paramount. With growing consumer demand for sustainable and ethical products, combined with the ever-increasing cost of leather, these companies are rapidly becoming essential players in the apparel industry. Here are the top 10 best non-leather footwear companies in USA in 2023 Allbirds – Allbirds is a sustainability-focused company based in San Francisco, California. Founded in 2016 by New Zealand entrepreneurs Tim Brown and Joey Zwillinger, Allbirds makes high-quality, ethically sourced shoes, apparel, and accessories. The company has become well known for its signature wool sneakers, which are lightweight and comfortable. In addition to wool sneakers, Allbirds also offers an array of other footwear choices including runners, casuals, loungers, and slippers. The company prides itself on making comfortable, responsibly designed products that are made from sustainable materials. Its commitment to sustainability extends beyond the materials used – Allbirds focuses on responsible production practices and reducing its carbon footprint. Allbirds also works to reduce waste through its “Buy Better” program, which encourages customers to reuse and recycle shoes. Allbirds has also established a Give Back Fund to support local communities and non-profit organizations. With global recognition and awards, Allbirds continues to make strides to become one of the most recognized sustainable companies in the world. Skechers – Skechers is a global footwear brand that was established in 1992. It has grown to become one of the most recognized and respected footwear companies in the world. Skechers designs, develops and markets lifestyle and performance footwear for men, women and children. The company’s products are sold in more than 170 countries around the globe. Skechers offers a wide variety of styles, from casual sneakers and sandals, to dressy boots and shoes for formal occasions. The company also produces a range of apparel and accessories including bags, hats, eyewear and shoe care products. Skechers prides itself on providing comfortable, stylish and affordable footwear to customers all over the world. In addition to its core retail business, Skechers also owns several subsidiary brands which focus on specific markets such as fashion, performance, kids and outdoor activities. Through its numerous collaborations with celebrities, sports teams and influencers, Skechers has been able to successfully increase its reach and market share. Skechers continues to innovate with cutting edge technologies and materials, leading to increasingly better and more comfortable shoes. With its commitment to providing quality and affordability, Skechers is truly a leader in the industry. Adidas – Adidas is a German multinational corporation that designs, manufactures and markets sporting goods. It is the largest sportswear manufacturer in Europe, and the second-largest in the world. Founded in Herzogenaurach, Germany, in 1924 by Adolf “Adi” Dassler, it has been one of the most successful and popular sport brands for decades. Adidas produces an extensive range of products, from running shoes to football boots, from tracksuits to sports bras, from clothing to accessories and more. Adidas’ mission is to be the best sports brand in the world, creating a “soul” for athletes who strive to perform at their highest level. Their products are designed and crafted to help them reach peak performance, while also providing timeless style. As such, they have become iconic across various sports, as well as in popular culture. Adidas is committed to sustainability, with a focus on reducing their environmental footprint wherever possible. This includes using recycled materials to create new products, investing in renewable energy sources, and supporting local communities. In addition, they are focused on encouraging people to adopt healthy lifestyles, and provide programs to help young athletes develop and reach their full potential. With its innovative designs, wide range of products and ongoing commitment to sustainability, Adidas is sure to remain a leader in the world of sports for years to come. Reebok – Reebok is a global footwear and apparel company dedicated to inspiring people to be their absolute best. Founded in 1895, Reebok has been at the forefront of sports and fitness for 123 years. It is one of the world’s leading brands in performance and lifestyle apparel, footwear, and accessories. The brand’s mission is to empower people to look, feel and be their best. Reebok offers a wide range of products from running shoes to apparel, accessories, training tools and gym equipment—all designed with functionality, quality, and style in mind. From classic looks to cutting-edge technology, Reebok has always stayed ahead of the curve. Its iconic shoes have become fashion staples, while its innovative materials and materials science have given high performance athletes the edge they need to succeed. Reebok also takes pride in its commitment to social responsibility and sustainable development. Its sustainability strategy focuses on renewable energy, waste reduction and conservation, as well as support for communities and wellbeing. Reebok works to ensure that all employees are treated fairly and with respect, and it participates in various initiatives aimed at empowering girls and women around the world. The Reebok brand stands for quality, durability, and innovation. It’s a brand that is committed to creating products and experiences that help everyone lead an active and healthy life. With its commitment to sustainability, social responsibility, and quality, Reebok is a brand that you can trust. Nike – Nike is a global athletic footwear and apparel company that was founded in 1964 by Bill Bowerman and Phil Knight. Based in Portland, Oregon, Nike designs, develops, manufactures, markets, and sells its products worldwide. The company’s product offerings include shoes, apparel, equipment, and accessories for a wide range of sports and activities. Nike products are widely recognized for their quality, innovation, and design. Nike is the world’s leading sportswear and athletic footwear brand, with annual sales totaling more than $37 billion. Nike has built its brand on performance, style, and value. Its slogan, “Just Do It”, encapsulates the company’s commitment to continuous innovation and setting new standards of excellence. Nike has developed a powerful presence in both the retail and online worlds, as well as through its highly successful marketing campaigns. One example of its success is its “Dream Crazier” commercial which aired during the 2019 Super Bowl and featured female athletes such as Serena Williams, Simone Biles, and Chloe Kim. Nike is also committed to creating a positive impact on the communities it serves. The company supports initiatives that promote health and fitness, education, youth empowerment, sustainability, and diversity. In addition, Nike is dedicated to promoting its core values of innovation, collaboration, and inclusion. For example, the company launched an initiative called “Girl Effect” which provides girls around the world with access to education, financial literacy, and life-skills training. Nike continues to be an industry leader, and its mission is to create products and experiences that inspire and enable athletes to reach their full potential. With its commitment to innovation, sustainability, and community engagement, Nike is helping to shape the future of sport and fashion. New Balance – New Balance is a global footwear and apparel company founded in 1906. It is renowned for its expert craftsmanship, modern design language, and innovative technologies. The company’s goal is to provide the perfect fit for every customer, no matter what their needs may be. New Balance has invested heavily in research and development, resulting in a range of products designed for athletes of all kind. Their shoes are designed to help runners stay comfortable and perform better for longer. New Balance also offers a broad selection of apparel, from performance tops and shorts to leisure pieces like hoodies and tees. New Balance’s commitment to excellence starts with the materials they use. Through partnerships with leading suppliers, New Balance has developed revolutionary fabrics that not only feel great but also offer superior performance benefits. Their Responsive Cushioning System provides cushioning and flexibility, while also adapting to your individual foot shape and movement. This allows you to stay comfortable and perform at your peak level over long periods of time. In addition to providing quality footwear and apparel, New Balance is committed to providing a positive impact on the communities it serves. The company supports various initiatives and charities to help build healthier lives and communities. They also strive to reduce their environmental footprint by using sustainable materials, such as recycled polyester in some of their products. Overall, New Balance is a reliable and trustworthy brand that offers high-quality products designed with the customer in mind. With cutting-edge technology and materials, New Balance is dedicated to helping athletes of all kinds reach their potential. Vans – Vans is a leading footwear and apparel company that has been around for over 50 years. The company was founded in 1966 by Paul Van Doren and three partners in Anaheim, California. Vans is best known for its iconic slip-on shoe designs, which were originally created for skateboarders. Today, Vans is a popular lifestyle brand, offering a wide variety of shoes, clothing, and accessories for men, women, and children. Vans is dedicated to celebrating creative self-expression and individuality. The company supports collaborations with artists, musicians, and athletes from around the world to create unique designs, products, and experiences that inspire creativity. Vans also sponsors events such as the Vans Warped Tour, an annual touring music and extreme sports festival. In addition, Vans encourages and supports skateboarding, BMX, surfing, and snowboarding through various initiatives, such as the Vans Park Series and the Vans Triple Crown of Surfing. Vans strives to make meaningful contributions to the communities where it operates, donating time and resources to support local initiatives. With a commitment to quality and style, Vans will continue to be a leader in the stand out footwear and apparel industry. Puma – Puma is an iconic German sportswear brand, founded in 1948 by brothers Rudolf and Adolf Dassler. Puma is one of the world’s leading sports lifestyle companies that designs, develops, sells, and markets footwear, apparel, and accessories for men, women, and kids. The company has a presence in over 120 countries and employs more than 13,000 people worldwide. Puma’s mission is to be the most desirable sports lifestyle brand in the world. They focus on innovation, sustainability and performance, all rooted in their brand values of optimism, creativity, and collaboration. Their product range includes everything from running shoes, soccer cleats, and golf apparel to lifestyle shoes, urban streetwear, and athleisure clothing. The company has built a strong reputation over the years through partnerships with some of the world’s top athletes and celebrities. These include Usain Bolt, Lewis Hamilton, Selena Gomez, Cara Delevingne, Adam Levine, and many others. Moreover, they are committed to inspiring a healthy and active lifestyle through campaigns like “Do You” and “Forever Faster”. Puma also prides itself on being at the forefront of sustainability initiatives. They have implemented the PUMA Environmental Profit & Loss (PEP&L) program which measures and assesses the impact of their operations on the environment. This program helps ensure that their business practices are as sustainable and responsible as possible. Apart from this, Puma also supports numerous philanthropic causes such as fighting AIDS/HIV, supporting children’s education, and providing relief during natural disasters. All these efforts make it clear that Puma is a company that cares about its customers, its employees, and the planet. Converse – Converse is a footwear and apparel company that has been around since 1908. Founded in Massachusetts, it has a long history of making stylish sneakers and fashionable clothing for men, women, and children. Over the years, Converse has become known for its classic Chuck Taylor All Star sneakers, as well as its collaborations with pop culture icons like John Varvatos and Miley Cyrus. The company has also released limited edition styles, often featuring unique colors and designs. Today, Converse offers a wide selection of apparel and accessories, including T-shirts, hoodies, jackets, shorts, outerwear, bags, and hats. As part of its commitment to sustainability, Converse sources environmentally-friendly materials and strives to reduce its footprint. In 2020, Converse launched a platform called ‘The Conversation’ that focuses on giving back to the communities it serves. Through ‘The Conversation’, Converse partners with local organizations and initiatives to drive positive change. As of 2021, Converse has stores in more than 65 countries and continues to provide products with comfort and style. Keds – Keds is a footwear company founded in 1916 by U.S. Rubber. Its iconic canvas sneakers are a favorite among celebrities and fashionistas alike. The brand’s philosophy of “Let’s Go” resonates with young people everywhere. Keds offers shoes for men, women and children, ranging from casual to dressy. The company has made strides over the years by introducing innovative technologies such as memory foam insoles, breathable mesh panels and stretch fabric for added comfort. Keds also uses premium materials such as leather, suede and canvas for its shoes. The company’s designs have always been stylish and trendy, making it popular among people of all ages. Keds has collaborated with several well-known designers to create limited edition collections. Recently, the company has released a line of vegan sneakers, made entirely out of recycled materials. This move shows the company’s commitment to sustainability. Keds continues to be an industry leader by creating comfortable, fashionable and high-quality products. They strive to make sure their customers feel confident and empowered every time they put on a pair of Keds shoes. CONCLUSION In 2023, non-leather footwear companies in the US continue to be a major force in the footwear industry. Companies such as Nike, Adidas, New Balance, Under Armour, Vans and Skechers have made significant strides in the market, offering consumers a variety of styles and price points. The use of synthetic materials has also enabled many companies to produce shoes that are both stylish and affordable. In addition, environmental sustainability has become an increasingly important factor for many companies, leading them to focus on creating more eco-friendly footwear options. Overall, the future looks bright for non-leather footwear companies in the US, with innovation and customer satisfaction continuing to be key drivers of success.

title: Top 10 Best Handicraft Companies In USA 2023 - Inventiva
published_parsed: time.struct_time(tm_year=2023, tm_mon=3, tm_mday=6, tm_hour=8, tm_min=0, tm_sec=0, tm_wday=0, tm_yday=65, tm_isdst=0)
summary: Top 10 Best Handicraft Companies In USA 2023  Inventiva
title_detail.value: Top 10 Best Handicraft Companies In USA 2023 - Inventiva
summary_detail.value: Top 10 Best Handicraft Companies In USA 2023  Inventiva
source.title: Inventiva
text: INTRODUCTION Handicrafts are becoming increasingly popular in the United States. From paintings and sculptures to unique jewelry, these handcrafted items are in high demand by those who appreciate quality craftsmanship and unique designs. In 2023, there are numerous handicraft companies across the country that offer a variety of products. In the Midwest, there is Blanketworks, which creates blankets and accessories from a blend of natural and synthetic fibers. The company offers a wide range of colors and patterns that allow customers to create their own personalized blankets. In the South, Cotton & Clay creates handmade pottery and ceramic dishes. This company focuses on creating functional pieces of art that can be used in the home. In the Northeast, there is North Shore Pottery, which specializes in creating one-of-a-kind vessels and decorative pieces. Each piece is handmade with care using traditional methods and materials. In the West Coast, Moondance Jewelry creates stunning pieces of jewelry using a variety of gemstones and precious metals. Every piece is unique and custom made for the customer. No matter where you live in the United States, there are sure to be plenty of handicraft companies available in 2023. By supporting local artisans, you can help promote the vibrancy of the handmade community. IMPORTANCE Handicraft companies in the United States are becoming increasingly important in 2023. This is due to a few key factors, such as an increased demand for handmade goods and products, the rise of online shopping, and a growing appreciation for craftsmanship. Handicraft companies are able to provide unique, one-of-a-kind products that customers find appealing and desirable. Additionally, many of these companies specialize in unique items that are difficult to find elsewhere. Customers appreciate the customized, personal touch that comes with shopping with handicraft companies. The popularity of e-commerce websites has made it easier than ever for consumers to shop from home. This has been particularly beneficial for handicraft companies, as they can now reach a much larger customer base. In addition, with the help of social media and other forms of digital marketing, handicraft companies can better promote their products, as well as let customers know about new products and special offers. As more people become interested in supporting small businesses, there is an increased demand for handmade items. Handicraft companies offer unique items that cannot be found in stores and this makes them attractive to customers. Furthermore, many of these companies are led by artisans who have a deep understanding of the craft and are passionate about delivering quality products. They take pride in the work they do and this is reflected in their products. The rise of sustainability initiatives has also helped to increase the importance of handicraft companies. Consumers are becoming more conscious of their environmental impact, which has encouraged them to purchase products that are locally sourced and produced in an eco-friendly manner. By shopping with handmade products, customers are supporting local businesses and helping to reduce their carbon footprint. Overall, handicraft companies are becoming increasingly important in 2023 as demand for their services and products grows. Customers appreciate the unique, customized products they offer, and the fact that they are supporting sustainable practices and local businesses. Handicraft companies provide an invaluable service and are sure to remain relevant in the years to come. Here are the top 10 best handicraft companies in USA 2023. TerraCycle – TerraCycle is a global upcycling and recycling company that works to eliminate the idea of waste. Founded in 2001, TerraCycle collects difficult to recycle packaging and products and repurposes them into affordable and innovative recycled products. Their aim is to divert non-recyclable materials away from landfills and create innovative solutions for hard to recycle materials. They are involved in many projects around the world, including their Loop initiative which aims to minimize single-use plastic and create a closed loop system to reuse resources. TerraCycle’s main mission is to create a world where nothing is wasted. To achieve this goal, they focus on four main areas: Upcycling, Recycling, Composting and Education. With their upcycling initiatives, TerraCycle takes difficult to recycle items and turns them into creative, new products. Through this process, TerraCycle makes sure these items will never end up in landfills. Through their recycling initiatives, TerraCycle creates closed-loop systems for items such as coffee capsules, toothbrushes, and other hard to recycle items that are not recyclable through traditional methods. Using their composting initiatives, TerraCycle also helps to turn organic waste into valuable fertilizers and soil amendments. In addition, they offer educational initiatives to help people learn more about reducing, reusing, and recycling. With over 20 years of innovation and experience, TerraCycle has become an international leader in the circular economy. They have diverted billions of pieces of waste from landfills and created countless upcycled products in the process. TerraCycle is paving the way for a future with zero waste by leading the charge in creating a circular economy. Lakeshore Learning Materials – Lakeshore Learning Materials is a family owned and operated educational supplies company founded in 1954. They specialize in providing quality materials for early childhood and elementary classrooms. The company’s mission is to help teachers and parents create engaging, enriching, and inspiring learning environments for children. Lakeshore is headquartered in Carson, California and operates over 130 stores in the United States, Canada, and Puerto Rico. The company offers a wide variety of products including classroom furniture, manipulatives, language arts materials, math activities, science experiments, music and movement items, art supplies, and parent resources. Additionally, Lakeshore offers professional development sessions, seminars, and workshops for educators. Lakeshore also provides teachers with access to their online store, where they can purchase lesson plans and other materials from their own computer. In addition to its retail presence, Lakeshore has an extensive catalog model that allows customers to order items from the comfort of their own homes. With the catalog model, customers can have products shipped directly to their doorsteps. Furthermore, Lakeshore also offers a rewards program that allows customers to earn points for purchases and redeem them for gifts or discounts. Lakeshore’s commitment to providing high-quality educational materials and resources to teachers and parents has made it one of the most respected brands in the industry. For nearly 70 years, Lakeshore has remained dedicated to helping children develop creative minds and a love of learning. CONCLUSION Handicraft companies in the USA are thriving in 2023.
